message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyzed the latest dataset from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) as well as data from national agriculture censuses to study the impact of climate change on agriculture productivity in South Asia.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)", "national agriculture censuses"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using a panel dataset from 2010-2020, we find evidence of a positive relationship between government debt and interest rates in 15 European Union countries.", "dataset": ["panel dataset from 2010-2020"], "topic": ["Debt", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on several datasets, including satellite imagery from the European Space Agency, household survey data, and weather station data.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery from the European Space Agency", "household survey data", "weather station data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Disaster Risk Management", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses a unique dataset that combines information on firm-level financials with administrative data on employment and taxes to examine the determinants of firm survival during the COVID-19 pandemic.", "dataset": ["unique dataset that combines information on firm-level financials with administrative data on employment and taxes"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Our research builds on multiple datasets including primary surveys conducted by Global Solar Atlas, NASA's Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC), and Africa Development Bank.", "dataset": ["primary surveys conducted by Global Solar Atlas", "NASA's Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC)", "Africa Development Bank"], "topic": ["Energy", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We use a comprehensive dataset from the World Economic Forum that allows us to examine the effects of corruption on economic growth and social welfare in 137 countries worldwide.", "dataset": ["comprehensive dataset from the World Economic Forum"], "topic": ["Governance", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis combines several datasets, including labor force surveys, firm-level data, and census data, to study the determinants of women's participation in the labor market and the gender wage gap across Sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["labor force surveys", "firm-level data", "census data"], "topic": ["Gender", "Jobs & Development", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using a comprehensive dataset of natural gas infrastructure projects across Europe, we conduct a cost-benefit analysis of investments in security of supply and environmental sustainability.", "dataset": ["comprehensive dataset of natural gas infrastructure projects across Europe"], "topic": ["Energy", "Infrastructure", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses survey data from multiple rounds collected by the World Bank, the latest Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HIES), and Demographic Health Surveys to analyze the dynamics of poverty and inequality in Bangladesh.", "dataset": ["World Bank", "Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HIES)", "Demographic Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We combine satellite data from NASA MODIS and land use data from the European Space Agency to assess the effect of land cover changes on soil moisture in Northern Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["NASA MODIS", "European Space Agency"], "topic": ["Environment", "Disaster Risk Management", "Agriculture and Food"]}]
